turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: DAPHNE?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I never did like the name Geraldine.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Hello, everybody.  I'm the bass fiddle. Just call me Daphne.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I'm Josephine.  Sax.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: How about that talent?  This is like falling into a tub of butter.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Watch it, Daphne!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: When I was a kid, I used to have a dream - I was locked up in this pastry shop overnight - with all kinds of goodies around - jelly rolls and mocha eclairs and sponge cake and Boston cream pie and cherry tarts -

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Listen, stupe - no butter and no pastry. We're on a diet!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Not there - that's the emergency brake.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Now you've done it!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Done what?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Tore off one of my chests.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You'd better go fix it.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You better come help me.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: This way, Daphne.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Now you tore the other one.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I changed it.  It used to be Sugar Kowalczyk.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Polish?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Bye, Sugar.  We been playing with the wrong bands.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Down, Daphne!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: How about the shape of that liquor cabinet?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Forget it.  One false move, and they'll toss us off the train - there'll be the police, and the papers, and the mob in Chicago...

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Boy, would I like to borrow a cup of that Sugar.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Look - no butter, no pastry, and no Sugar!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You tore it again!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Men?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Oh, you don't have to worry about that.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: We would be caught dead with men.  Those rough, hairy beasts with eight hands -  They all want just one thing from a girl.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Steady, boy.  Just keep telling yourself you're a girl.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm a girl.  I'm a girl.  I'm a girl -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I just want to make sure that honey stays in the hive.  There'll be no buzzing around tonight.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: But suppose I got to go - like for a drink of water?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Fight it.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: But suppose I lose?  Suppose it's an emergency?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Then pull the emergency brake!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Good night, Daphne.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Good night, Josephine.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What's going on here?  Daphne - Daphne -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It's not my fault.  I didn't invite them.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Break it up, girls!  Daphne! Come on, help me!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Male and female - the moth and the flame - I ought to slug you!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You wouldn't hit a girl, would you?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I got pinched in the elevator.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well, now you know how the other half lives.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: And I'm not even pretty.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: They don't care - just as long as you wear skirts.  It's like waving a red flat in front of a bull.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm tired of being a flag.  I want to be a bull again.  Lets get out of here, Joe. Let's blow.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Blow where?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You promised - the minute we hit Florida, we were going to beat it.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: How can we?  We're broke.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: We can get a job with another band. A male band.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Listen, stupid - right now Spats Colombo and his chums are looking for us in every male band in the country.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: But this is so humiliating.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: So you got pinched in the elevator. So what?  Would you rather be picking lead out of your navel?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: All right, all right!  But how long can we keep this up?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What's the beef?  We're sitting pretty. We get room and board - we get paid every week - there's the palm trees and the flying fish -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What are you giving me with the flying fish? I know why you want to stick around - you're after Sugar.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Me?  After Sugar?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I watched you two on the bus - lovey-dovey - whispering and giggling and borrowing each other's lipstick -

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What are you talking about?  Sugar and me, we're just like sisters.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yeah?  Well, I'm your fairy godmother - and I'm keeping an eye on you.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yeah - let her soak.  Come on.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Don't get burned, Daphne.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What is it, young lady?  What are you staring at?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You - you -

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: This happens to me all the time in public.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I heard a very sad story about a girl who went to Bryn Mawr.  She squealed on her roommate, and they found her strangled with her own brassiere.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yes - you have to be very careful about picking a roommate.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: He's not only got a yacht, he's got a bicycle.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Daphne -  Go on - tell me all about him.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You know - the old shell game.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Daphne, you're bothering us.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Wise guy, huh?  Trying to louse me up -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: And what are you trying to do to poor Sugar?  Putting on that millionaire act - and that phony accent -  Nobody talks like that!  I've seen you pull some low tricks on dames - but this is the trickiest and the lowest and the meanest -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm a push-over for whom?  What is it? Who's on the phone?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Yes, Mr. Fielding - you'll pick her up after the show in your motorboat - goodbye - what's that you said?  Oh - zowie! I'll give her the message.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What message?  What motorboat?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You got it made, kid.  Fielding wants you to have a little cold pheasant with him on his yacht -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, he does!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Just the three of you on that great big boat - you and him and Rudy Vallee.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Fat chance!  You call him right back and tell him I'm not going.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Of course, you're not.  I'm going.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You're going to be on the boat with that dirty old man?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: No.  I'm going to be on that boat with Sugar.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: And where's he going to be?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: He's going to be ashore with you.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: With ME?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, no!  Not tonight, Josephine!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Daphne - your boy friend is waving at you.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You can both go take a flying jump.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Remember - he's your date for tonight. So smile.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Come on, you can do better than that. Give him teeth - the whole personality.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Why do I let you talk me into these things? Why?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Because we're pals - buddies - the two musketeers.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Don't give me the musketeers!  How'm I going to keep the guy ashore?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Tell him you get seasick on a yacht. Play miniature golf with him.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, no.  I'm not getting caught in a miniature sand trap with that guy.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What are you doing with my flowers?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I'm just borrowing them.  You'll get them back tomorrow.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Hi, Jerry.  Everything under control?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Have I got things to tell you!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm engaged.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Congratulations.  Who's the lucky girl?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I am.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: WHAT?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Osgood proposed to me.  We're planning a June wedding.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What are you talking about? You can't marry Osgood.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You think he's too old for me?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Jerry!  You can't be serious!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Why not?  He keeps marrying girls all the time!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: But you're not a girl.  You're a guy! And why would a guy want to marry a guy?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Security.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Jerry, you'd better lie down. You're not doing well.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Look, stop treating me like a child. I'm not stupid.  I know there's a problem.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I'll say there is!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: His mother - we need her approval.  But I'm not worried - because I don't smoke.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Jerry - there's another problem.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Like what are you going to do on your honeymoon?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: We've been discussing that.  He wants to go to the Riviera - but I sort of lean toward Niagara Falls.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You're out of your mind!  How can you get away with this?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, I don't expect it to last.  I'll tell him the truth when the time comes.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Like when?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Like right after the ceremony.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Then we'll get a quick annulment - he'll make a nice settlement on me - I'll have those alimony checks coming in every month -

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Jerry, listen to me - there are laws - conventions - it's just not being done!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: But Joe - this may be my last chance to marry a millionaire!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Look, Jerry - take my advice - forget the whole thing - just keep telling yourself you're a boy!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm a boy - I'm a boy - I wish I were dead - I'm a boy - I'm a boy -  What am I going to do about my engagement present?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What engagement present?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Hey - these are real diamonds.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Naturally.  You think my fiance is a bum? Now I guess I'll have to give it back.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Wait a minute - lets not be hasty. After all, we don't want to hurt poor Osgood's feelings.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: That's some nerve!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Daphne got a proposal tonight.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I feel like such a tramp - taking jewelry from a man under false pretenses.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Get it while you're young.  And you better fix your lips.  You want to look nice for Osgood, don't you?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It's just going to break his heart when he finds out I can't marry him.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: So?  It's going to break Sugar's heart when she finds out I'm not a millionaire.  That's life.  You can't make an omelette without breaking an egg.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What are you giving me with the omelette?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Nag, nag, nag.  Look, we got a yacht, we got a bracelet, you got Osgood, I've got Sugar - we're really cooking.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Joe -

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I tell you, Joe, they're on to us.  They're going to line us up against the wall and -  Eh-eh-eh-eh-eh - and then the police are going to find two dead dames, and they're going to take us to the ladies' morgue, and when they undress us - I tell you, Joe, I'm just going to die of shame.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Shut up and keep packing.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Okay, Joe.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Not that, you idiot.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: But they're from Osgood.  He wanted me to wear them tonight.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Joe, if we get out of this hotel alive, you know what we're going to do? We're going to sell the bracelet, and grab a boat to South America and hide out in one of those banana republics -  The way I figure is, if we eat nothing but bananas, we can live there for fifty years - maybe a hundred years - that is, if we get out of the hotel alive.  Did we forget anything?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: There's our shaving stuff - and there's Sugar.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Sugar?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Get me Room 414.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What do you think you're doing?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Telephone call?  Who's got time for that?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: We can't just walk out on her without saying goodbye.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Since when?  Usually you leave 'em with nothing but a kick in the teeth.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: That's when I was a saxophone player. Now I'm a millionaire.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Drop her a postcard.  Any minute now those gorillas may be up here -

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Hello, Room 414?  This is the ship-to-shore operator - I have a call for Miss Sugar Cane.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Hello, my dearest darling.  So good to hear your voice again.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I may throw up.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I don't know about the captain - but the navigator is getting his tail out of here.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Yeah - lets shove off.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Wait a minute - my bracelet.  What happened to my bracelet?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What do you mean, your bracelet? It's our bracelet.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: All right. What happened to our bracelet?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Don't worry.  We did the right thing with it.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What did we do?  Joe, you're not pulling one of your old tricks.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: No tricks, no mirrors, nothing up my sleeve.  It's on the level this time.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You crazy or something?  The place is crawling with mobsters - gangrene is setting in - and you're making like Diamond Jim Brady!  How are we going to get out of here?  How are we going to eat?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: We'll walk.  And if we have to, we'll starve.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: There you go with that we again.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: All right - so what do we do now?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: First thing we got to do is get out of these clothes.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Did you hear that?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Yeah, but they're not watching yachts. Come on - you're going to call Osgood.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What'll I tell him?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Tell him you're going to elope with him.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Elope?  But there are laws - conventions -

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: There's a convention, all right.  There's also the ladies' morgue.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It's all fixed!  Osgood is meeting us on the pier -

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: We're not on the pier yet -

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: OH!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Terribly sorry.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: That's all right.  I was afraid it was Sweet Sue. You won't tell anybody, will you?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: That's us.  I'm Daphne - and this is Josephine.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: I'm Sugar Cane.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: She sings, too.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: I don't really have much of a voice - but then it's not much of a band, either.  I'm only with 'em because I'm running away.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: We'll take a rain check.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: I don't want you to think that I'm a drinker. I can stop any time I want to - only I don't want to.  Especially when I'm blue.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Are my seams straight?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'll say.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: See you around, girls.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Good night, Sugar.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Good night, honey.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Honey - she called me honey.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh - Sugar!

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: I wanted to thank you for covering for me. You're a real pal.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It's nothing.  I just think us girls should stick together.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: If it hadn't been for you, they would have kicked me off the train.  I'd be out there in the middle of nowhere, sitting on my ukulele.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It must be freezing outside.  When I think of you - and your poor ukulele -

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: If there's anything I can do for you -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, I can think of a million things -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: And that's one of them.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Sssh.  Sweet Sue.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: I don't want her to know we're in cahoots.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: We won't tell anybody - not even Josephine.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: I'd better stay here till she goes back to sleep.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Stay as long as you'd like.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: I'm not crowding you, am I?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No.  It's nice and cozy.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: When I was a little girl, on cold nights like this, I used to crawl into bed with my sister.  We'd cuddle up under the covers, and pretend we were lost in a dark cave, and were trying to find out way out.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Interesting.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Anything wrong?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No, no.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Why you poor thing - you're trembling all over.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: That's ridiculous.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: And your head is hot.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: That's ridiculous.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: And you've got cold feet.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Isn't that ridiculous?

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Let me warm them a little.  There - isn't that better?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm a girl, I'm a girl, I'm a girl -

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: What did you say?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm a very sick girl.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Maybe I'd better go before I catch something.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm not that sick.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: I have a very low resistance.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Look, Sugar, if you feel you're coming down with something, the best thing is a shot of whiskey.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: You got some?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I know where to get some.  Don't move.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: You all right?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm fine.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: How's the bottle?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Half-full.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I tell you - this is the only way to travel.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: You better put on the lights. I can't see what I'm doing.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No - no lights.  We don't want anyone to know we're having a party.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: I may spill something.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: So spill it.  Spills, thrills, laughs, games - this may even turn out to be a surprise party.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: What's the surprise?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Uh-uh.  Not yet.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: We better have a drink first.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Here.  This'll put hair on your chest.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No fair guessing.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Who needs vermouth?

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: We have some bourbon - lets make Manhattans.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: And bring the cocktail shaker.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, Sugar.  You're going to spoil my surprise.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Not you, Sugar.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: I'm just going to get some ice.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'll carry the instruments.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Thank you, Daphne.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Here you are, Sugar.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: A bunch of us girls are going for a swim. Want to come along?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You betcha.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: See?  She doesn't have one either -  You don't?

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: We'll rent some at the bathhouse. How about you, Josephine?

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Oh, I have some suntan lotion.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: She'll rub it on me - and I'll rub it on her - and we'll rub it on each other - bye.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: What do you think you're doing?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Just a little trick I picked up in the elevator.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: You know, Daphne - I had no idea you were such a big girl.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You should have seen me before I went on a diet.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: I mean, your shoulders - and your arms -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: That's from carrying around the bull fiddle.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: But there's one thing I envy you for.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: You're so flat-chested.  Clothes hang so much better on you than they do on me.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Come on, Sugar - time to change for dinner.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Run along, Daphne - I'll catch up with you.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: I recognized him too - his picture was in Vanity Fair.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Vanity Fair?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: His yacht?

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: It sleeps twelve.  This is my friend Daphne. She's a Vassar girl.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm a what?

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Or was it Bryn Mawr?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, please do come.  Don't disappoint us. It'll be such fun.  And bring your yacht.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Come on, Daphne.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, I'll be - !   How about that guy?

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Now look, Daphne - hands off - I saw him first.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Sugar, dear - let me give you some advice. If I were a girl - and I am - I'd watch my step.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: If I'd been watching my step, I never would have met him.  Wait till I tell Josephine.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yeah - Josephine.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Will she be surprised. I just can't wait to see her face -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Neither can I.  Come on - lets go up to her room and tell her - right now.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: We don't have to run.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh yes, we do!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Josephine -

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: I guess she's not in here.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: That's funny.  Josie -  I can't imagine where she can be.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Well, I'll come back later.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No, no, Sugar - wait.  I have a feeling she's going to show up any minute.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Believe it or not - Josephine predicted the whole thing.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yeah.  This is one for Ripley.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Do you suppose she went out shopping?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: That's it.  Something tells me she's going to walk through that door in a whole new outfit.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, come on - you can do better than that.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: I met one of them.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What do you mean, maybe?  I saw the way he looked at you.  He'll be there for sure.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: I hope so.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What do you think, Josephine?  What does it say in your crystal ball?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Yes.  He wants me to have supper with him - on his yacht - he's going to pick me up at the pier.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: I thought I heard voices - and I just had to talk to somebody.  I don't feel like going to sleep.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I know what you need - a slug of bourbon.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Did he get fresh?

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Of course not.  As a matter of fact, it was just the other way around.  You see he needs help.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: And talk about elegant - you should see the yacht - candlelight - mint sauce and cranberries.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: How did you get that bracelet?

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: You like it?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I always did.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Junior gave it to me.  It must have at least thirty stones -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Thirty-four.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: He's going to South America to marry some other girl - that's what they call high finance.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: That's what I call a louse!  If I were you, Sugar, I'd throw that bracelet right back in his face.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Brand new.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: This is our manager, Mr. Bienstock. I'm Sweet Sue.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Where did you girls play before?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh - here and there - and around.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: How did those holes get there?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh - those.  I don't know.  Mice?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Didn't you girls say you went to a conservatory?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yes.  For a whole year.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I thought you said three years.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I was it.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: What's the big idea?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm sorry. I was having a nightmare.  Something I ate.  I'm not at all well.  See?  Hot water bottle.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It's about the Florida job.

turns.speaker: POLIAKOFF
turns.text: The Florida job?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: What's wrong with us?

turns.speaker: POLIAKOFF
turns.text: You're the wrong shape.  Goodbye.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: We could pass for that.

turns.speaker: POLIAKOFF
turns.text: - you got to be blonde -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: We could dye our hair.

turns.speaker: POLIAKOFF
turns.text: - and you got to be girls.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: We could -

turns.speaker: POLIAKOFF
turns.text: Yes, I'm holding on.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Wait a minute, Joe.  Lets talk this over.  Why couldn't we do it?  Last year, when we played in that gypsy tearoom, we wore gold earrings.  And you remember when you booked us with that Hawaiian band?  Grass skirts!

turns.speaker: POLIAKOFF
turns.text: What's with him - he drinks?

turns.speaker: POLIAKOFF
turns.text: Hello, Mr. Morris? This is Poliakoff, in Chicago. Say, you wouldn't have a couple of girl musicians available? A sax player and a base?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Look, if William Morris doesn't come through -

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: Just a moment, miss -  May I?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Help yourself.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: I am Osgood Fielding the Third.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I am Cinderella the Second.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: If there is one thing I admire, it's a girl with a shapely ankle.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Me too.  Bye now.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: Let me carry one of the instruments.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Thank you.  Aren't you a sweetheart?

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: It certainly is delightful to have some young blood around here.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Personally, I'm Type O.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: You know, I've always been fascinated by show business.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You don't say.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: Yes, indeed.  It's cost my family quite a bit of money.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You invest in shows?

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: No - it's showgirls.  I've been married seven or eight times.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You're not sure?

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: Mama is keeping score.  Frankly, she's getting rather annoyed with me

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm not surprised.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: So this year, when George White's Scandals opened, she packed me off to Florida.  Right now she thinks I'm out there on my yacht - deep-sea fishing.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, pull in your reel, Mr. Fielding. You're barking up the wrong fish.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: If I promise not to be a naughty boy - how about dinner tonight?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Sorry.  I'll be on the bandstand.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: Oh, of course.  which of these instruments do you play?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Bull fiddle.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: Fascinating.  Do you use a bow or do you just pluck it?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Most of the time I slap it.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: You must be quite a girl.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Wanna bet?

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: My last wife was an acrobatic dancer - you know, sort of a contortionist - she could smoke a cigarette while holding it between her toes - Zowie! - but Mama broke it up.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: She doesn't approve of girls who smoke.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Goodbye, Mr. Fielding.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: Goodbye?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: This is where I get off.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: Oh, you don't get off that easy.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: Please.  It won't happen again.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: No, thank you.  I'll walk.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: But it's such a waste - a full moon - an empty yacht -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'll throw up!

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: Well, then, why don't we go dancing? I know a little road-house, down the coast -

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, I'll be - !  He does have a bicycle.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: About that roadhouse -

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: They got a Cuban band that's the berries. Why don't we go there - blindfold the orchestra - and tango till dawn?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You know something, Mr. Fielding? You're dynamite!

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: You're a pretty hot little firecracker yourself.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: Daphne...

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yes, Osgood?

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: You're leading again.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: This is my friend Josephine - she's going to be a bridesmaid.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: Pleased to meet you.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Come one!

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: Another bridesmaid?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Flower girl.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: I called Mama - she was so happy she cried - she wants you to have her wedding gown - it's white lace.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Osgood - I can't get married in your mother's dress.  She and I - we' not built the same way.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: We can have it altered.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, no you don't!  Look, Osgood - I'm going to level with you. We can't get married at all.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, to begin with, I'm not a natural blonde.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: It doesn't matter.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: And I smoke. I smoke all the time.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: I don't care.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: And I have a terrible past.  For three years now, I've been living with a saxophone player.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: I forgive you.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: And I can never have children.

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: We'll adopt some.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: But you don't understand!  I'm a MAN!

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: Well - nobody's perfect.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: This is her roommate.  Daphne can't talk right now.  Is it anything urgent?

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: Well, it is to me.  Will you give her a message?  I'd like her to have a little supper with me on my yacht after the show tonight.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Got it.  Supper - yacht - after the show - I'll tell her.  Your yacht?

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: The New Caledonia.  That's the name of it.  The Old Caledonia went down during a wild party off Cape Hatteras.  But tell her not to worry - this is going to be a quiet little midnight snack - just the two of us.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Just the two of you?  What about the crew?

turns.speaker: OSGOOD
turns.text: Oh, that's all taken care of.  I'm giving them shore leave.  We'll have a little cold pheasant - and champagne - and I checked with the Coast Guard - there'll be a full moon tonight - oh, and tell her I got a new batch of Rudy Vallee records -

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: That's good thinking.  Daphne's a push-over for him.
